FacilityName: Farmers Coop Elevator Company - Belmont Branch

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at our facility: This facility complies with OSHA (29 CFR 1910.111), ASME Standards, ASME Standards, and the State Board of Agriculture requirements for anhydrous ammonia storage, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Norwich Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.



This is facility is an agricultural marketer. We deliver anhydrous products to our customers. We store our anhydrous ammonia inventory in one 26,000-gallon tank.  This facility may also have up to 30 nurse tanks that could hold up to 131,070 pounds of product.  



Our worst-case scenario as well as our alternate case have been removed at the request of the EPA.  This is due to security concerns as dictated by the Homeland Security Act.



This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. This anhydrous ammonia system is installed and maintained in accordance with all regulations and state law.  Note:  The state of Kansas has not yet adpoted the most recent version of the ANSI standards.  However, this company understands the importance of keeping our facilities safe and we will committ the needed time and funds to make any needed repairs.



We have never had an accident involving anhydrous that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.



In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous ammonia system, it is our policy (Emergency Action Plan)  to notify the Norwich Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency. We have discussed this policy with the fire department.  By definition we do not have an Emergency Response Plan because we require all employees to evacuate the area and call 911 immediately in the event of an accident or release of NH3.



There are planned im
provements needed at this time and they are being implemented as budget allows.
